newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: Lithuanian shares ease, no end seen to slump.
newsitem.headline: Lithuanian shares ease, no end seen to slump.

text.p: * Lithuanian shares eased in light trade on Monday and no end was seen to the slump.
* The official list index lost 12.72 points to close at 926.63 while the Litin A index slipped 11.82 points to 2,330.42.
* Overall market volume was around 3.4 million litas.
* The central market turned over a sluggish 908,000 litas while the secondary T-bill market was a dull 1,989 litas.

* Electronics component producer Vilniaus Vingis saw over 2.3 million litas worth of its shares swapped in a block trade and dealers said a foreign investor was trying to take a substantial stake in the firm.
The share price for the block trade was 5.25 litas, a bit lower than the 5.33 litas which the company's shares were trading for on the central market.
* Vilniaus Bank was one of the session's few gainers, rising to 235.00 litas from 232.00 litas in trade of 117,500 litas.
Lithuanian shares eased in light trade on Monday and the mood among dealers was far from bullish.
"This market won't rally this week," said one dealer.
External factors putting a damper on the country's struggling bourse included the strong dollar, which the Lithuania litas is pegged to at a rate of four to one.
Dealers said companies which rely heavily on exports could be hit by the strong dollar, lowering their share price.
Closer to Vilnius, external factors were mixed. Estonian share prices eased while the market in neighbouring Latvia showed signs of recovery after last week's lows.

The market's biggest transaction involved a 2.3 million litas block trade Vilniaus Vingis shares. Dealers said a foreign investor was snapping up shares in the electronics components producer but could not name the buyer.
The share price on the block trade was 5.25 litas, slightly lower than the 5.33 litas which the company's shares were going for on the central market.
Vilniaus Bank was of the session's few gainers, rising to 232.00 litas from 227.00 litas in trade of 117,500 litas.
Siauliu Bank eased for the second straight day, falling to 90.00 litas from 100.00 litas in trade of only 1,710.00 litas.
Its price soared during a four-session bull-run last week which was sparked by Hermis Bank's announcement that it wanted to acquire 51 percent of its shares.
"Siauliu seems to have risen a little too far and too fast," said one dealer.
